description: One of the most iconic structures dominating London’s skyline, One Canada Square is the third tallest building in the UK. It is Canary Wharf Group's landmark tower which houses Europe’s most influential FinTech scaler, Level39.

factsheet.heading: Canary Wharf Background
paragraphs: Canary Wharf Group (CWG) is the developer of the largest urban regeneration project in Europe. CWG develops, manages and currently owns interests in approximately 9 million square feet of mixed-use space and over 1,100 Build to Rent apartments.
CWG is the largest sustainable developer in the UK and also excels operationally as it purchases 100% electricity from renewable sources since 2012 and zero waste to landfill since 2009.

CWG has created a 24/7 city where people can live, work and thrive on the Canary Wharf estate and enjoy all the benefits: great transport links, access to green spaces and waterside living; and a wide range of amenities including an award-winning arts and events programme. Canary Wharf’s retail offering comprises over 300 shops, including grocery stores, pharmacies, health clubs, bars and restaurants, all within 15 minutes’ walk.
The Company’s current £2bn construction activity and pipeline includes more than 500k sq ft NIA of commercial properties and over 2,300 new homes for sale and rent.

•	120,000 daily working population
•	Five retail malls including the award-winning Crossrail 
        Place
•      One of London’s biggest roof gardens and 
       over 300 shops, bars and restaurants
•	Over 200 culturally inspired events each year - most of 
        which are free to attend including the hugely popular 
        Winter Lights festival
•	20 acres of outdoor space and 17.2 million sq ft of 
       completed office and retail space
•	Award winning public art collection with over 100 pieces 
       – the largest free to visit public art collections in the UK
•	Around 49 million visits made each year to Canary 
       Wharf

factsheet.heading: One Canada Square
paragraphs: Designed by Cesar Pelli and located at the heart of the Canary Wharf estate
Built on the original dock that received imports from the Canary Islands
Construction of Canary Wharf began in 1988
When completed in 1991, One Canada Square was the tallest office building in Europe with a height of 800 feet (244 metres) and 50 storeys
Located within a couple of minutes’ walk of three tube stations (on the Jubilee line and Elizabeth line) and DLR stations
Over 90,000 square feet of Guatemalan and Italian marble was used in the triple height lobby
Total of 3,960 windows
Lifts travel from ground level to the top in 40 seconds
Average floor size 28,000 square feet
In excess of 27,500 tonnes of British Steel and 50,000 bolts used in construction
Designed to reflect the sky, the exterior walls are clad in 370,000 sq ft Patten Hyclad Cambric finish stainless steel
Aircraft warning light on the very top of the Tower flashes 40 times a minute, 57,600 times a day.

factsheet.heading: Level39
paragraphs: Level39 opened in March 2013 and is based in One Canada Square. ‘L39’ is the world’s most connected technology community; giving access to world class customers, talent and infrastructure.

Occupying the entire 39th floor of the iconic One Canada Square building at Canary Wharf, Level39 helps the next generation of technology companies achieve huge growth by putting our high-potential businesses in the same room as the world’s most influential tech buyers, investors and mentors.

Level39 has to appeal to two very different stakeholder groups: the business community, and the technology ecosystem. Therefore, we had to think long and hard about the design of our space. Techies need somewhere creative and versatile to work, whilst the space needed to maintain the professionalism expected by the financial sector. We worked with the architects Gensler to achieve this goal. As Gensler have worked with both banks and organisations such as Facebook in the past – we thought they would be the right people to help us hit this middle point.
